website_summaries.verdict: The Jaybird X3 is a significant improvement over the X2 and one of the top Bluetooth sports headphone currently available.
pros: The Jaybird X3 wireless sports headphone is smaller than the X2, has improved battery life, costs less and sounds excellent for an in-ear Bluetooth headphone
It's sweat resistant and comes with a compact protective carrying pouch
cons: Don't lose the charging accessory or you'll have no way to charge the headphone
not as comfortable as the Bose SoundSport Wireless
noise-isolating design may be a safety issue for runners

customer_reviews.title: Unusable after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up the X3s because I had good luck with a rugged pair of X2s, and had heard problems about the X4s. Well I should have just went with another brand. After a few months of use, the X3 are worthless for working out or running. With a full charge, so much as a tiny bump to the volume controls, the headphones turn off. I stop running, I turn them back on and the overly perky robot voice tells me they need to be charged. I turn them off for 10 min, and the magically are changed again. If you're looking for reliable headphones for the gym or running or whatever, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: KungFu Pirate Pants

customer_reviews.title: Awesome size but it seems to not last last long ...
customer_reviews.text: Had this for less than 90 days. Tried to turn the item on today & the button will not power on. It is fully charged since the light is green. I've been a Jaybird user for 5 years & this is unsatisfactory. This is not how I remember Jaybird quality....what happened? I had the same issue with the Jaybird Freedoms. Awesome size but it seems to not last last long as the older BBX.
customer_reviews.author: F. YATCO

customer_reviews.title: Ordered them because my son recommended them. The first set I bought ended up---one ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered them because my son recommended them. The first set I bought ended up---one side--one ear bud stopped working, but when I contacted Jaybird and Amazon, they quickly (as in the next day) sent me a new pair and I returned the original to them. Their customer service is top notch and their product is wonderful. Easy to set up and use. Lasts about three days in the gym (I spend about an hour and half - two hours every day) and easy to recharge. They don't slip or fall out either as long as you find the right ear bud size.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J.

customer_reviews.title: Did not stay in ear.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get these to stay in place. I went thru all the accessories and it just didnt work for me. Now I did get to test them out while not moving but as soon as i stood up they would dislodge. They paired easy enough and were fine if you listened to a podcast,but I found listening to music to be lacking. It was a bit tin y while listening to music. I was hoping they would work based on the reviews they just didnt work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fitting is tricky, but they work great once you get it
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great and once you figure out which tips and "wings" work best for you, they stay in great. I've done several races with these in and they didn't slip a bit. However, I will reiterate that figuring out the correct tip and wing fit for you is somewhat tricky and takes some trial and error. That's the only reason I gave them four stars instead of five--finding the correct fit is a bit of a pain. But I'm committed to these earbuds b/c I don't want to spend money on others and these work great once you get the fit right.
customer_reviews.author: amazon1

customer_reviews.title: Simply The Best
customer_reviews.text: The Best Bluetooth Headset on the market. I have used Jaybirds for several years and the X3 is by far the best. It did take getting adjusting to the charging system on this one, but not so difficult to understand. The product is very durable, however, I personally know that the life expectancy drops when I use them in both Wet and Dry Sauna. I have now replaced all the old Jaybirds with the new X3, and maintain 4 at all times. I use the Black for Business and the Red for Sports. Great sound quality for both music and talking on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Not even close to sweat proof.
customer_reviews.text: They lasted 3 months before they would only go 20min on a charge then failed to charge at all. Jaybird warrantied them and sent a new pair but those lasted 4 months with the same results. Both pairs I made sure to dry them with a towel before putting them away and charged them using a USB port on my laptop as recommended by their customer service staff. Too bad as the design is great, probably the most comfortable and unobtrusive headphones to use for working out but sweat proof these are not. I previously owned the X1 and they were great was hoping for an improvement
customer_reviews.author: Joshua J. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great buds, terrible battery
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about these earbuds... The fit the app and most importantly the sound. But unfortunately the batteries in these units absolutely suck. I am on my second warrantee pair. The first pair lasted about six months when the batteries died and the second pair lasted about two months. Jaybird has been very quick to replace my buds and they are sending out a third pair now. I hope maybe I just got unlucky twice but I’m not holding my breath. Too bad... I love those things
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good headphones, but the charging clip is hokey and cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using these headphones, and sound quality if very adequate, but the charging clip has two very small nubs that 'secure' the headphones for charging. Mine just sits on my desk, and within a year those nubs wore down such that I had to order a new $20 clip. Overall I like these headphones, but it is hard not to be disappointed is such non-robust charging system. Hopefully subsequent designs are better.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy Jaybird/Logitech
customer_reviews.text: These are my fifth pair of Jaybirds. I purchased them to replace an old pair that just stopped working after several years of daily use. These stopped charging 34 days after I purchased them and 4 days after the return window from Amazon closed. Years ago, I had a problem with my first pair of X1s and Jaybird’s customer support was phenomenal. Now these phones may as well be orphans since the company was purchased by Logitech. No product support from either Jaybird or Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Great earbuds. I almost loved them but having to clip on the charging case to charge the earbuds was a bit of a nuisance and i lost it and had to get replacement. And the inside ear wings would fall off my ear during my work shift.The foam bud coverings were great though at blocking out noise. I work at a noisy warehouse and didn't hear anything when i had my jaybirds
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: After going through about 4 pairs of Bluetooth earbuds I was about to give up and accept that Bluetooth music playing will never sound great. I tried this X3's after hearing a few recommendations about it and wow, these actually play music really well. Not to mention you can download an app to apply your own pre-set or custom made EQ. Only negative is the way these earbuds charge with a specific charging clip that Jaybird makes. If you lose it you will have to buy a new one to charge ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Brad G

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes change isn't for the better.
customer_reviews.text: I don't care for the charging port. It was so much easier to plug in to the ear phone itself. I have to wonder about the charge connecters ( not sure that is what they are called) being exposed to sweat and weather. Has the durability been compromised ? I also do not understand why the ear fins have been doubled in width? ( I am posting a picture to explain what I mean) very uncomfortable for those of us with tiny ears 😕 These may be returned and I will have to search for the ones like I had. Little less fancy but better fit , less exposure may win the toss up.
customer_reviews.author: R York

customer_reviews.title: awful reception, literally unusable, now my backup pair
customer_reviews.text: dont buy this product. the bluetooth receiver is of the poorest quality out there. huge downgrade from the j2. what this means, is that for my music to not skip every couple seconds, i need to hold my phone right up to the device and not move. forget jogging, forget working out, forget raking the lawn, forget storing your phone in your pocket and walking. complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Edward P.

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is better than most wired buds & with the app you ...
customer_reviews.text: The left side ear sometimes falls out but then again my inner ears gets very moist during exercise plus with the weight of the controls it makes it more prone to coming out. Ive had an intermittent issue where the music cut out but I believe that was due to my phone's wifi. Asides from that it is very well made. 1 hour per day at the gym & I won't need a charge for 1 week before it reaches 20% or so. The sound quality is better than most wired buds & with the app you can find tune it to your liking. I would recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great workout headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sound great, adjustable sound via the app (theres like thousands...! You can also create your own) stay in at the gym no matter what I do, and have gotten sweat on with no problems. Battery life is as advertised, and these are also very light and unobtrusive. Cons: proprietary charger that seems easy to lose. For me I just take extra special care to keep track of it, has not been an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sonneillon

customer_reviews.title: If your ear canals are compatible
customer_reviews.text: Very challenging to fit. Once they were in, sound quality was great-only with comply tips. Did not like the tones following powering on and off. Returned, recommend Bose Soundsport wired or wireless for same price or $20 more. Instant, easy fit with them.
customer_reviews.author: Braedon

customer_reviews.title: A story about wires
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I needed some earbuds, saw they were $20 for a renewed model so I got them. However I had used apple airpods before these and the after going wireless you can't go back. I had the X3 only for a month before I decided that I needed to get rid of these wires, so I just got myself some Samsung Galaxy buds plus. Honestly if it was 2016 2017 these would be great, but since it's 2020, wireless is much more convenient now than ever before. So I recommend that if you can save up for some wireless earbuds I would say do that instead for getting these. There great just not wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Chris1205

customer_reviews.title: If you sweat, don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: If you workout and sweat I do not suggest these. I have tried every fitment combination possible and without failure, the ear buds slip and fallout while working out! It’s very very frustrating having to adjust the earbuds every few seconds while running or doing any type of physical activity involving sweat. Yes, they are sweatproof, but are deemed pointless if sweat makes it slip out of your ears! I suggest that jaybird should provide ear hooks for instances like this.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound and VERY uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I work in a quiet office and like to listen to podcasts when I work. I have a pair of the Jaybird Freedom Sprint that I wear working out and love them. The X3 headphones, however, are honestly terrible. They are so uncomfortable. I tried switching them out for my gym ones at work, but the X3 suck at the gym too. Also, not sure why people are raving about the sound quality. It stinks. It’s very tinny and even with the “presets” in the app, they suck. And that’s by my very low standards.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Friedli

customer_reviews.title: Sound good too bad they never hold a connection!
customer_reviews.text: So these things sound good... When they work. They will not hold a connection. I've had them for over a year and have them connected to 2 different phones (pixel 1 and pixel 2). They consistently drop the connection. I've tried every on ear configuration, unpaired, repaired, done the hokey pokey and the connection still drops! I mowed the lawn with one hadnd on the mower (not safe I know) and one hand holding my phone 2" from these headphones and still the connection dropped! Maybe I got a bad set, but I wouldn't buy them again. You might be ok because Amazon has a good return policy but I should have returned these the from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Metzger

customer_reviews.title: Nope...
customer_reviews.text: These were promptly returned due to the need to use a charging cradle/clip on device. This rinky-dink crap means you need to carry the clip with you if you want to recharge ( at work, travelling ). And if you lose it, your $100 buds are useless. If you really want the Jaybirds, consider the X2. Little if any discernible difference in sound quality, considering these are meant for activity listening. And no need for clip.
customer_reviews.author: UnregisteredTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I’ve tried quite a few and these are the best so far. They don’t cut out, they sound great. Sometimes they fall out but not to the point that I want to throw them in the trash. Pretty good distance. I like that you can adjust sound via iPhone. Not sure about phone connection because I only use them for music. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bears, Bass, and Battlestar Galactica
customer_reviews.text: These really deliver! Battery life is pretty good with a charge usually lasting me all day under heavy use. Call quality is really good as well. They're comfortable enough but can get a little irritating after several hours of use. Calls and audio both come in over each ear bud. And the cord is nice and long and can be wrapped in several different ways. It doesn't stick to my neck either. A bit pricey but worth the buy if you want to finally stop throwing away cheap headphones. The app and foam headphones really wake up the music!
customer_reviews.author: Colin Estes

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get these and they have been a disappointment. The product keeps malfunctioning. For example, the sound occasionally crackles and sounds like static electricity. An automatic voice will come through the speakers says "headphones connected" over and over again - not supposed to happen. The ear plug shapes themselves are uncomfortable for long wear. I tried to wear them for hours while studying and wearing for a long period of time hurts. I'd half to take them out occasionally to give my ear a break. They stopped accepting a charge. Now they are dead and not being used. Really not happy about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Surrealdelight

customer_reviews.title: X3 sometimes skips audio when running
customer_reviews.text: The sound skips occasionally when I run. The support page suggested that my device might be too far from the headphones or that the bluetooth connection might not be able to get through my body... I'm 5'9 160lbs, the phone is in my hoodie pocket. I'm not a big guy or is that a far distance. I have also reset the headphones repeatedly to no avail. I didn't have this problem with the X2s. I hope that it's just a software issue and that they have a firmware update to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Christian J

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for exercise, but might lag on videos.
customer_reviews.text: After pairing to a few devices they had about 0.5 to 1.5 seconds of lag behind video. Annoyingly is watch videos where lips moves and then sound comes later. However, factory reset obstructions online did fix it most of the time. The only reason I gave 3 stars is due to lag. Others sound quality is key awesome.
customer_reviews.author: E P

customer_reviews.title: I would buy these again.
customer_reviews.text: I am changing my review from an initial evaluation. At that time I was not using the controls properly. The sound is very good. The controls are simple to operate even when running. It is apparently durable. I closed a dresser drawer on the cord and it did not damage the device
customer_reviews.author: honest assessment

customer_reviews.title: Can be defective - worth getting good ones
customer_reviews.text: My first pair wouldn't charge after the second charge. Amazon replaced it and the second pair worked perfectly. Great sound great fit. I accidentally put it through the wash in a hoodie pocket. It survived! Had some static and discharged quickly for a little while which I assume was water in the case but once it was completely dry it worked perfectly again. I probably decreased the lifetime of the headphones by inadvertently washing them but Ive broken enough pairs of all kinds of headphones just through regular use that I'm impressed with these. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: zacwight

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy them again
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned about 8 and they all cut out during phone calls or the bud itself was uncomfortable because of its size. These can hold a call and are comfortable, but...it has a small piece that you must use to charge. Yet another step in the twisted charging universe we created. Nonetheless, I would buy them again. Please note, I did not purchase them to listen to music, though.
customer_reviews.author: Lumen

customer_reviews.title: 2 in a row that stopped working completely in less than a week.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one after the other, they both completely stopped charging. I workout daily (run and lift), they are most definitely not water resistant. Even better, these products have so many issues that Amazon doesn't even provide support within the manufacturer's warranty unless you call them directly.
customer_reviews.author: J D

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. A $20 brand would last you longer.
customer_reviews.text: I used this 5 times a week for about 1 hr each time. They just died after 2 years. My $20 dll version still works and I use those 4 to 8 hr a day! Also after 1 yr the earbuds starting ripping apart. N Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Leviathan55

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: They look, feel and sound amazing. That app makes the difference. But sometimes the Bluetooth is not as smooth as I would like. Also the battery isn't the best, 7 hours average. At least the charging speed is great, approx. 1 hour to fully charge.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Snow

customer_reviews.title: These Jaybirds x3 are AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend anyone to try these out. The sound quality is Amazing. Starting from the lows which are excellent and continuing to the incredible mids and highs. The bass of these is great too which is not overpowering, but the bass( great)is definitely present. The jaybird app is Great because you can adjust to the listening experience you want. The Jaybirds x3s are in competition with other expensive headphones/earbuds—Bose, Sennheiser, jbl... etc. The comfort is great and the noise isolation is just excellent. I have had no issues. People might talk about these that they sound horrible, but being honest these sound Great so I recommend to try these out.
customer_reviews.author: Lol_8956

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and battery life but proprietary connector is inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: The sound and battery life are great, but I'm probably going to return them. They come with a proprietary connector so you can't use straight up USB micro or USB type-c. You need their proprietary connector which they only give you one of. They don't have a pack you can buy for a few dollars you have to buy the entire accessory kit to get another connector. I contacted their support we'll see what they do before I return them. For over $100 they should use standard USB or they should at least give you three or four of those tiny connectors.
customer_reviews.author: Redburd

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy - they drop Bluetooth signal constantly
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy these headphones. I have an apple-watch with all the latest updates. I purchased these headphones to listen to music via my apple-watch while running. The headphones cut-out for 1-3 seconds every 5-10 minutes. Unless the Bluetooth device (watch, phone, etc.) is within inches of the right headphone, they will not keep a signal.
customer_reviews.author: Alan B. Newton, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to make them fit correctly and not fall off
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase I’ve made in a while. You need a PhD to make these fit correctly and not fall off. Even though I managed to do so (watching YouTube videos) I’m still paranoid they’re going to fall off. I wouldn’t recommend them to anyone. I’m forcing myself to use them because I paid good money for them. I guess my ears are not designed for them.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Build is good will take a fall manny times and a good ...
customer_reviews.text: Price is right for what they are. Build is good will take a fall manny times and a good stomping on. Reception to blue tooth is just ok. Sound is clean but a little flat at times. Battery life about 5-6 hrs of music about 4 if your talking on the phone. Biggest issue the silicon ear buds fall off way to easy you will lose them, now the fome buds stay in nice but they get dirt because they are porous.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: they were a huge waste of money
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!! I bought these for mostly running, training for my 1/2 marathon. I got about 4 runs out of them before they died. On my last run, I powered them up to 40% battery life. 11 minutes later I was at 20%, then 2 minutes later it done. I put them on the charger, and nothing. I have a red light, and still nothing. They won't charge, they won't turn on, they were a huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They are good but it’s frustrating they won’t stay in my ears ...
customer_reviews.text: Update -- 6-13-18: You would think with the amount of money spent on them that the ear buds covers would last long but within four months they are all ripped up. I take pretty good care of them and keep them in a little baggy so I know they aren’t catching on things. They are good but it’s frustrating they won’t stay in my ears unless I have the clip hooking them on. The battery life isn’t great either.
customer_reviews.author: Hollister Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stability, solid battery life, above avg sound.
customer_reviews.text: These are incredible for working out. My wife had a pair and loved them so I got an a pair for myself. They charge quickly and hold the charge 8+ hours. My only complaint is sound quality. It is definitely above average, but doesn’t stand up against my vmoda crossfades that i have been using during workouts. It is an unfair comparison. But for in ear sound with such low weight and good battery life, these beat Bose and Beats in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Nickens

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound/volume. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use them when I mow the lawn. Excellent sound/volume. Easy to use. Durable. Quick charging. They can come loose sometimes (even though I have tried all the sizes and configurations) but it is quick and easy to put them back in place when this happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Mine stopped working in a week!
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought the sound quality was amazing but the battery life is horrible and it takes so long to turn it off and on. And now it stopped working altogether. I’m very disappointed because I wanted to try something different from Beats and saw these were ranked really high so I decided to try them. And they have been absolutely underwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Felt inclined to write a review just to save others money...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with these. Used them twice and a defect happened where the red charging light wouldn’t turn off, killing the battery. Talked to Jaybird’s customer support and they replaced them - after a ridiculous process that took nearly 2 weeks. Received the new pair and they did the same thing as the first pair after 3 uses - plus, I was wearing them on a run and they kept turning off...it seemed like from sweat getting into the ear buds. Awful product, will be going with another company. Would not recommend Jaybird to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They fall out of my ears!
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is nice. But I was very disappointed to find that these headphones simply will not stay in place in my ears (especially while in motion, as during running or other exercise), no matter how I adjust them. Really BIG drawback for me.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ann Nickerson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but picky about position in ear.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones seem really good, but if they're not in the right position in your ear, you either can't hear it or it's really soft. I'm sure it has to do with how well they seal in your ear with the silicone buds, but it's still annoying if you're wearing a helmet or doing something with your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Stepped up to the X3’s
customer_reviews.text: Decided to step up to the X3’s because I lost my original X’s. I like the clip and Comply tips that are included. I’m a bit of sound/music snob and after trying and reading about a number of other brands I’m glad I stuck with the Jaybirds.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Scanzera

customer_reviews.title: and this is the best overall I have found
customer_reviews.text: I have had several pairs of name brand earbuds, and this is the best overall I have found. I give it good ratings in every category: sound, fit, comfort and durability. It is definitely important to try out the different fins and earbud covers included in the box to find the correct fit. For running I have found the foam covers work best for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chad S

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last
customer_reviews.text: The charging cradle is horrible. They sound wonderful but can’t get them to charge after buying another cradle hoping they would charge. Please use a different charging system.
customer_reviews.author: smaree

customer_reviews.title: They are good headphones, with good sound
customer_reviews.text: They are good headphones, with good sound, and really nice app. However after a few months they don't hold a charge anymore. On a full charge they will let me do one workout and dead. I charged in the morning and in the afternoon when i turned them on they were on 75% with no use at all. So no i have to look for replacements. Its the second set of headphones from jaybird that dies on me less than 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: dlaitano

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones, if you win the gamble.
customer_reviews.text: The X3s aren't... bad! Not in the slightest. They're nice. However, it would be wonderful if their earbuds stayed on. I have been tempted to GLUE my earbuds in to keep them from falling off; they often would come off in my ear just from walking. Sound is balanced, but relatively quiet, and you will need a preset from the Jaybird app to really get the most out of these headphones. Shouldn't need an app to have good sound. Battery life is great though, and it comes with many convenient accessories.
customer_reviews.author: datten

customer_reviews.title: Not holding a charge
customer_reviews.text: I've had these earphones before, but the battery wasn't charging all the way. Bought these as a replacement only to receive these earphones unwrapped and defective. They did not even work for more than 30 minutes and then would die. Getting a replacement and hopefully the next set can hold a charge.
customer_reviews.author: SILLYLILY14

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty good, I have gone on a couple of runs and the plugs are tight in the ear and I am not afraid that they will fall out. I have experienced a bit of glitching when listening to music when running and having my phone in the jacket pocket, sort of sounds like the music quickly stops to buffer but it is the music I have downloaded on my phone and I have also seen others comment that the bluetooth isn't strong enough on this headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY VERY SAD
customer_reviews.text: This is SOOO BAD, only 2 days life, mine and my girlfriend gift, both not charge anymore, audio cuts always and suddenly die in TWO DAYS. I can't believe it. The WORST thing is that i cant sent it back because i'm outside US. So... I waste my money so bad, and a shame with my Girlfriend :(
customer_reviews.author: Goltnor

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN THE POWERBEATS!!
customer_reviews.text: I used powerbeats for my gym headphones for a couple of years i was convinced the beats were the best gym headphones. I have the jaybirds a try and i really like them. They sound better than the beats. The reason i dont give them 5 stars is because i dont like the charging method, and i think the battery life is good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Urena

customer_reviews.title: ... Jaybird 3 stars because The the Bluetooth range isn't great! I wanted something that could give me some ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving Jaybird 3 stars because The the Bluetooth range isn't great! I wanted something that could give me some hands free freedom around the gym with my stuff at a decent distance most I'm. Getting is 3 ft. And the fins are a bit troublesome. I'm sad about this ear phones. But the sound quality Is really good and I like that.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Was Great for a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 3 months. Now battery dies very quickly. Fully charged then not used it says battery at 40%. Charged full last last night then unplugged. This morning battery was dead. Not what you expect from a $100+ set of head phones
customer_reviews.author: Costa

customer_reviews.title: amazing sound
customer_reviews.text: i’ve had these earbuds for a few weeks now and they’re perfect. they hold a charge really well and the sound quality is amazing. adjusting the strap with the clips is a little tricky at first and getting the right fit with all of my piercings can be a little annoying but i love these earbuds!
customer_reviews.author: kandace

customer_reviews.title: Too bad Jaybird can't resolve their design issues
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've gone through 3 of these now since the original pair ordered 5 months ago. The last pair lasted 7 days and failed on the 3rd workout. It's really too bad because they sound good and fit well/stay in place, but battery/power supply circuit is a faulty design.
customer_reviews.author: public

customer_reviews.title: Beast Headset and price.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Jaybirds. This version has an ap on my Apple that lets me hear the music exactly as I wish. Great sound. I have tried more expensive head and keep coming back to come back to Jaybird.Their is just nothing better out there when it comes to comfort and sound.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after minimal usage
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were great... until they mysteriously died. There seems to be an issue affecting the X3 models that causes them to stop turning on, even through they'll charge correctly. I tried resetting, etc, no dice.
customer_reviews.author: QRohlf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome earphones
customer_reviews.text: These earphones have some POWER. And outsiders can't hear a thing. They connect easily, and the app has so many cool and useful controls. There are different types of eartips, wingtips, some noise cancelling some comfort intended, and all different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband to use at the gym and he so disappointed with the battery life. This is actually the third pair he's had and each time it's the same problem. He charges them to 100% and then within 15 minutes at the gym, they stop working. I am so tired of spending $75 on a pair of headphones for them to not last. It's a joke!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were overpriced & the worst ever for sound
customer_reviews.text: Hard to keep in my ears no matter which tips I wear. Logitech sent me a charger because it stopped charging now the hissing is in both ears. Ordered July 11, 2017 , so hopefully I don't go through a big hassle. These were overpriced & the worst ever for sound. I read lots of reviews, guess from now on I will be more mindful of the 3 star & less reviews. The only good thing is battery life.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Don't reccomend
customer_reviews.text: The only one thing that disappoints- really bad connection. When you walk away just 2 feet it starts dropping. It's really a bummer. Only one reason why I didn't give it 1 star is that the sound quality, sweat resistance and comfort is really good. But bluetooth connection - the only reason why you take these kind of headphones- sucks.👎
customer_reviews.author: Iryna

customer_reviews.title: Beware of 2nd party sellers
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if I like it because the charge cradle and cable were missing. Cannot charge without. Without a charged headset, I can't tell how to rate them. Replacement of missing accessories would cost $35. Purchased because I've had great luck with Sport X1 and X2. This, not so much. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: FogNamedKarl

customer_reviews.title: Kept Popping Out. Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan. I was wary of an earbud headphone because I have trouble with them fitting. This was sadly no different. The buds kept popping out. Tried multiple sizes on the tips to no avail. They also were not comfortable. If I can’t stand just walking around the house in them for half an hour, I don’t know how I can run in them. Maybe if your ears are better suited for earbuds, they will work better for you.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Ratcliffe

customer_reviews.title: and love them, but now I am not so sure ...
customer_reviews.text: It has a new charging system that does not use mini usb, but a dedicated cable, this creates a big problem if you forget the charging cable! I have both the version 1 and 2 of these Birds, and love them, but now I am not so sure about their new charger.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Delgado Morales

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. Great customization between ear fit to very usable app. You can change sound profile. The fit and finish is great. Sound quality is amazing for the size. Podcasts are clear and hip hop has great base. Glad I got them.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for about 6 months more or less. I've never listened to any other buetooth headphones so I can't compare to any other. But compared to wired earbuds, these are pretty good compared to wired earbuds. I would have liked a little more bass, but other than that no problems. No connection problems, just the sound quality isn't the very best I've heard
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTheOverSpender

customer_reviews.title: Battery Issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife. Mine hold a charge without any issues but hers will loose all its charge after a few days of being turned off. Unfortunately they were bought 1 1/2 months ago and I can not return to amazon but will be contacting Jaybird under warranty
customer_reviews.author: W. Hatch

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest but not bad either
customer_reviews.text: i just got these 5 days ago and the sound is already kinda glitchy.... maybe it's just my pair that's messed up. also i lost my charger and now it looks like i have to spend another $40 for the clip :/ don't think this is all worth it again. sorta dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Low frequency hissing out of the box... Nice look and feel, very sub-par audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Paired with Google Pixel, with up-to-date Jaybird app. Persistent low frequency popping and hissing. Reset device multiple times, issues still persisted Audible pops and hissing when switching between different applications (with and without jaybird app on) They look cool, packaged nice with a lot of options and fit well, but audio quality is quite poor, especially for the premium price.
customer_reviews.author: JediFX

customer_reviews.title: Giving this item 3/5 stars for the moment. Stopped ...
customer_reviews.text: Giving this item 3/5 stars for the moment. Stopped working after 14 days of normal use. Simply refused to turn on. Currently have a replacement, will see how the longevity of this unit compares. Sound-wise these headphones are solid for working out. Maybe I initially received a dud, but a quick search reveals some potential quality control issues post Logitech buyout. Purchase with caution. Meh.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Not good for iPhone users
customer_reviews.text: iPhone users beware, this pair of earphones have a 500-600 millisecond audio lag on my iPhone 8. This makes it quite unbearable for me when watching videos or playing games on my iPhone 8. Listening to music is fine, though. However there is no lag when I am using these earphones on my windows PC and it seems that this issue is only present in iPhones as my android phone did not have any audio lag.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: not as good as the Gen1 X's
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my jaybird X headphones (gen 1), they sound ok, but not anywhere near as good as the X's love love love the fit, you could get hit by a bus and they'd stay in. RED Color = Dope.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis & Sarah

customer_reviews.title: very bad
customer_reviews.text: Handset battery ends quickly and not as description .i already bought the black one and work for ten hours .Looks like it's a new generation and I wouldn't recommend buying
customer_reviews.author: Waleed A Alghanim

customer_reviews.title: Solid Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are pretty great! I had never even heard of Jaybird until I was reading reviews on bluetooth earbuds. Needless to say, I took a chance on these due to reviews I read on Amazon and elsewhere. Very slim lined, and perfect for workouts, working in the yard, etc. The only complaint I have is the clip that comes with them to secure the buds to prevent losing them-not a big deal. Overall, I am not disappointed in my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Blaire

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life
customer_reviews.text: Ear buds are great but charging port is auful. Hard to snap in cradle. Battery only lasted 6 months. Bought different brand as a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needed cordless headphones for my Versa
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Work with my new Fitbit versa! The little angel wings help them stay in place in my ears. Battery power seem to last for my two morning workouts. I just charge them again after my I’m done.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wing

customer_reviews.title: I really like these, the fit I am still getting use ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, the fit I am still getting use to. I was able to customize my sound with my phone, but that wasn't easy to do. Still couldn't get the base where I wanted it. Lost one of those ear wings first week, that was a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POOR FIT
customer_reviews.text: The fit is poor. There is actually a video you need to watch to adjust the multitude of accessories it comes with -- I tired them all and they still don't fit properly. I just ordered the Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Crafty Girl

customer_reviews.title: they sound much better..
customer_reviews.text: Sounds a bit tangy, but when you customize through the application, they sound much better... The only problem is when you use them with the Apple Watch Series 3, the customized sound does not follow to the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, but battery and comfort lacking.
customer_reviews.text: Sound great, but the Battery does not last near as long as stated and I have yet to find the foam inserts that make these wearable for more than a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Burns

customer_reviews.title: better audio quality
customer_reviews.text: A definite step up from the X2, better audio quality, doesn't disconnect randomly anymore (S7 edge)
customer_reviews.author: DubmasterW

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Responding
customer_reviews.text: I got this product on back in June 2018 and by Oct 13 2018 it just stopped responding. I tried to put it in the charger but all it does is the green light but nothing else. Put a complaint through the manufacturer but still not response. I will update once I get something from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: JAYMAR

customer_reviews.title: I have hade these earbuds 4 months they went from an eight hour charge to a 3 to 4 hour charge very disappointed. The manufacturer will send another pair but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this product if u expect an eight hour charge . I have hade these earbuds 4 months they went from an eight hour charge to a 3 to 4 hour charge very disappointed. The manufacturer will send another pair but I wouldn’t purchase again, when I get my replacement set I’ll let u know if it’s better or not again so disappointed in this product 8 hour charge false advertising 😞
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: X3 is hard to beat
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair after my original finally kicked the bucket. Love this model.
customer_reviews.author: BBQisgreat

customer_reviews.title: Not durable DON'T BUY
customer_reviews.text: not durable at all. high hopes with MKBHD Recommendation did not last more than 3 months and this is the second pair i have bought. sorry jaybird no more money from me
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are so simple and easy to use, and with the Jaybird app their true potential really comes out. They fit great, sound great, and look great. Only earbuds I'll ever recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kreykes

customer_reviews.title: Use them all the time.
customer_reviews.text: I liked these so much I gave them away as presents to my family.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Sprunger

customer_reviews.title: Its great
customer_reviews.text: I really like these earbuds they are good for working out. Although i dont like how they need to be charged exactly 2 hours in 50 minutes if you over charge them you are decreasing battery life. And they need a specific charger brick 5v--1A. And the earbuds Slip easily out i problaby didnt put the ear hook incorrectly. Otherwise theses are really good earbuds with a solid sound
customer_reviews.author: Fernando gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Range seems to be less than 3' ...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's just my set - but reception is lousy (crackly, staticky) if my iPhone is more than a couple of feet from this headset. So, if iPhone is in my pocket (I'm over 6' tall) then sound is unlistenable. If I carry my phone, then it's okay ... mostly. Not very practical for workout or, even, just for walking around.
customer_reviews.author: Westsider

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Stopped working after a couple months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely made the mistake of being brand loyal. My X2s went through hell and back. These have stopped working after only a couple months of light use. Good money for a big inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Stops Recharging. Useless.
customer_reviews.text: They fit perfectly in my ears and sounded was great. The battery lasted three workouts before I had to recharge them. Three weeks into using them, they would not recharge. I left them on the charger for a full weekend and nothing. I googled them to discover that this is a common problem with the Jaybird wireless headphones. I wish I had googled the reviews before I bought them. I'm returning them. $137 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Jelani

customer_reviews.title: Great for the gym
customer_reviews.text: These work great especially during activities like going to the gym etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jay P

customer_reviews.title: Fit is perfect although the sizing is kind of difficult
customer_reviews.text: Fit is perfect although the sizing is kind of difficult . I am a runner and I have no problems with these falling out which is what i was concerned about.
customer_reviews.author: Jsmith8905

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: These headphones work great. HOWEVER, I hate that I have to keep track of an attachment to charge them. Inconvenient and super annoying. The charging attachment is awkward to boot. I loved my X2 where I could charge simply with the nearest phone charger. The X3 also does NOT hold a charge for long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Major flaw with product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first buds from Jaybird about 5 years ago and have never had an issue. Just purchased the X3 as a birthday gift and am now sending them back. Horrible lag time! After researching this, it appears to be a rampant problem with these with zero effort by the company to improve the problem. So, I will be looking elsewhere for Bluetooth headphones. Very frustrating as the original Jaybirds were fabulous. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love em.
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal Jaybird customer since the original freedom and the X1. These are a decent improvement over the X2's I bought my wife. Better battery, better sound quality, louder, and even a bit lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Lycan66

product_meta.title: Jaybird X3 In-Ear Wireless Bluetooth Sports Headphones – Sweat-Proof – Universal Fit – 8 Hours Battery Life – RoadRash
product_meta.description: Color:RoadRash RedStream audio wirelessly from any Bluetooth enabled music device (smartphone, digital music player, tablet or computer) to secure-fit, sweat-proof micro-sized sport in-ear headphones. Full 8 hours of use on a single charge. Micro-sized universal-fit with over-ear and under-ear fit options. Market leading Bluetooth signal strength ensures a consistent music experience with no drop outs. Sweat-proof seam design and a hydrophobic nano coating ensures the product is safeguarded against sweat damage even during intensive exercise. Jaybird’s patented enhanced-comfort ear fins and Comply premium isolation memory foam ear tips allow a comfortable secure fit within your ear. Your buds will stay solid when exercising. Customize your sound settings with the Jaybird MySound App and save them to your X3 headphones, no matter what music device they’re paired with or what music service you use.
feature_bullets: The buds offer a full 8 hours of use between charges allowing for a full day of music or a full week of exercise

UNIVERSAL SECURE FIT –The patented silicone ear fins securely attach to the top and back/lower surface areas of the ear for a snug fit, locking the earbuds in during workouts and intense physical activities. Includes multiple sizes of silicon and Comply tips for maximum noise isolation, fit, and comfort
Hydrophobic nano coating ensures the product is safeguarded against sweat damage and rain showers even during intensive exercise. This allows X3 to be used during exercise with confidence

Personalize your sound settings and have them stored on your earbuds for use with any music device. The Jaybird MySound app gives you full control of your X3 sound profile. Width: 1.1 inch, height: 1.09 inch, depth: 0.52 inch, weight (with fins and tips) : 0.63 ounce, cord length : 19.29 inches
The ability to wear the device in the under-ear or over-ear position to completely lift the cord off the back of the neck. Your X3 will stay securely in your ears while you are being active

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars417 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: USB 2.0 Charging Cable, Cord Management Clips, Pair Comply Isolation Tips
